itemDescription: English musician and composer, mandolin, piano and violin

wikipedia_page.main: George H. Hucke (1868 – 20 March 1903) was a musician, playing both violin and mandolin, and he became one of the most popular English composers for the mandolin. He was also the author of an 1893 mandolin method called Forty Progressive Studies for the Mandoline, published by John Alvey Turner. Part of the BMG movement. Hucke died in Hammersmith London.

response: * George H. Hucke. Forty Progressive Studies for the Mandoline (London, 1893, English)
